answers.answer: What happened to bring it about?You can head to the ER or to a chiropractic physician. We haven't really heard much of the details about what is going on with you here, and there are a number of things that can cause what you are describing....so to be on the safe side.... go to the ER and get checked out.

Hello.The advice given by NKarapasas is absolutely correct. Your symptoms could be due to any possible cause. It could be a neuropathic presentation, a  carpel tunnel, etc. Please consult a physician. Get your routine blood work done.Do you have diabetes ?Regards

I had the same problem.  I talked about it with my Chiropractor first and he was able to bring it back into full function after only three therapy sessions.  Mine was caused because I have been spending too much time on the computer and holding my left arm in a position where it was cutting off the nerve to my hand.  Sort of like carpal syndrome that I have had before and the Chiropractor helped that too.When you have a problem that is concerning your nervous system, in my opinion, no one knows more than a Chiropractor and they will tell you if they can't help.  Saves sitting in the ER for hours and hours.

question: I have had tingling and numbness in all of my fingers on both hands for 3 days.  Should I make an appointment with a chiropracter or go the emergency room?
title: Tingling in fingers
